result.execSummary:
The defendant Giovanni W E Birch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE will complete an AODA assessment and complete any follow up recommended.

DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up treatment recommended.

Complete an evidence based domestic abuse intervention program.

No abusive contact the the victim.

Pay restitution, court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge, pay Domestic Abuse surcharge.

Comply with all recommendations from DOC agent.

DE will have credit of 12 days if revoked. 

2022GF1 consolidated into 2022CM35.

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt:
1:16 PM Defendant Giovanni W E Birch appeared by video.  Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Giovanni W E Birch.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 21CM127, 21CM134, 21CM135, 22CM35.  Per Atty Cook an agreement has been reached.  Atty Cook recites agreement into the court record.  DE will enter a plea in 21CM127-Ct 2 and 22CM35-Ct's 3,5.  All other cases and counts will be DRI.  

Court has colloquy with DE on his right to personal appearance as opposed to appearing by ZOOM.  DE waives personal appearance. 

Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE advised of Constitutional Rights, Factual basis/ PC found, plea freely, knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently made, court accepts plea of NC, finds DE guilty. 

21CM127-Ct 2.  DE will pay a fine of $300.00 plus court costs, DNA surcharge/sample.

22CM35-Ct's 3,6.  Withhold sentence 2 years probation, DE will complete an AODA assessment and complete any follow up treatment recommended, DE will complete the Rusk County Domestic Abuse Intervention program, no abusive contact with the victim, pay restitution of $450.00, pay CC, provide DNA sample/pay surcharge, DOM surcharge.  12 days credit if revoked. 

Parties make sentencing argument.  1:30 pm-Atty Cook and DE will go into a breakout room.  1:47pm back on the record.  Adj 1:51pm

3:54 PM Defendant Giovanni W E Birch not in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Giovanni W E Birch.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Heard along with 21CM127, 21CM134, 21CM135, 22CM35.  Per Atty Cook DE has been released from Clark County Jail, was to appear via phone.  Court will set all cases for 9/01/22 @ 1:15. ZOOM.  Adj 3:56pm.
Defendant's Waiver of Personal Appearance
DE has indicated undecided
